meanings.definition: The quality or state of being insular.
meanings.sent1: Her insularism prevented her from understanding different cultures.
meanings.sent2: The insularism of the small island community made it hard for outsiders to integrate.
meanings.sent3: Despite his insularism, he couldn't resist trying the exotic food at the new restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The insularism of the group was like a fortress, keeping out any new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The insularism of the town was so strong that even the birds seemed to avoid flying over it.

meanings.definition: A narrow-minded or isolated point of view.
meanings.sent1: His insularism made it challenging for him to accept different opinions.
meanings.sent2: The insularism of the group led to conflicts with those who had more open perspectives.
meanings.sent3: Despite her insularism, she couldn't help but laugh at the silly joke.
meanings.sent4: The insularism of his beliefs was like a thick fog, obscuring any other viewpoints.
meanings.sent5: The insularism of the team was so intense that they couldn't see beyond their own biases.
